intro: Chamaelirium koidzumianum var. koidzumianum, commonly known as the Koidzumi's grass of Parnassus, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Iridaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and striking, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and requires a cool, moist environment to thrive. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
